summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Brendan Quigley regarding the scheduling and preparation for an interview with David Rodgers, a witness in the Epstein investigation. The prosecutors plan to question Rodgers about a specific entry in Epstein's flight logs from August 1, 1997, concerning a missing teenager from Florida.

persons.name: Brendan Quigley
persons.context: Attorney representing David Rodgers, corresponding with federal prosecutors to schedule his client's interview and provide flight log records.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Individual subpoenaed by the SDNY for an interview regarding flight logs related to the Epstein investigation. His attorney is Brendan Quigley.

persons.name: Andrew Lankler
persons.context: Attorney at Baker Botts copied on the email correspondence regarding the David Rodgers subpoena.

connections.description: Quigley is the legal representative for David Rodgers, arranging his interview with prosecutors and producing his flight logs.
Both are attorneys at the law firm Baker Botts working on the David Rodgers subpoena matter.

events.title: Scheduled Interview of David Rodgers
events.description: Planned meeting between SDNY prosecutors and witness David Rodgers to discuss flight logs related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Flight Log Entry for Missing Teenager
events.description: An entry in Jeffrey Epstein's flight logs for a flight from SAR to ZOR lists an individual with a name similar to a missing Florida teenager.

events.title: Initial Production of Flight Logs
events.description: Attorney Brendan Quigley provides the SDNY with David Rodgers's flight logs dated between January 2006 and September 2013.

events.title: Additional Flight Log Production
events.description: Attorney Brendan Quigley provides the SDNY with additional flight logs for David Rodgers from 1991 to January 2006.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors from the SDNY are investigating a potential connection between a 1997 flight log entry and a missing teenager from Florida.
The flight log entry from August 1, 1997, lists a passenger with a name similar to the missing teen on a flight designated from SAR to ZOR.
David Rodgers is treated as a witness, and the interview was intended to focus on the flight records he possessed.
The email chain reveals the logistical and procedural coordination between federal prosecutors and defense counsel for a witness interview.
Flight logs for David Rodgers covering 1991 to 2013 were produced to the government under confidentiality protections.
